Primary Offense: Medicare Parts C and D Enforcement Action
Medicare Parts C and D Enforcement Action

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Company: Globe Life Insurance Company of New York
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Company: Globe Life Insurance Company of New York
Description: The New York State Department of Financial Services fined Globe Life Insurance Company of New York $439,000 after the company improperly denied claims and rescinded life insurance policies for 439 deceased policyholders and engaged in unfair claims settlement practices in violation of New York Insurance Law.  The policies had a face amount of approximately $7,330,000 and were marketed to low- and middle-income New Yorkers for funeral, burial and other final expenses.
Agency: New York Department of Financial Services

Description: Fine levied for doing business through unlicensed call center employees who were required to be licensed. RCW 48.05.140(9)
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Company: Globe Life and Accident Insurance Company of Omaha, Nebraska
Description: Globe Life agreed to pay $4.5 million to settle multistate litigation relating to its rating, marketing and sales practices but $1.2 million was deferred.
Insurance company was accused of charging higher premiums for African-Americans than similarly situated whites.
Private Litigation Case Title: Moore, et al v. Liberty Natl Ins Co
